page.title: 15TRANSPORT
page.content: There are two 'B' roads running through this area and both have a bus service. Three services run daily, except Sundays, on the B4306 route Pontyberem-Carmarthen, but there are eleven buses, on the B4309 route daily, except Sundays, Pontyates-Carmarthen. The majority of the population live on farms and have some means of private transport e.g. car, van, landrover. The nearest railway station is at Carmarthen, which is a market town. Trains travel to Fishguard or as far as London from this station. Only cars are suitable on most of the minor roads because they are so narrow. Tractors and other large vehicles are too wide and churn up the hedge banks making roads muddy.
